head.title: E.P.A. Orders Cleanup of Site in Montana

hedline.hl1: E.P.A. Orders Cleanup of Site in Montana

abstract.p: Environmental Protection Agency orders W R Grace & Co to clean up site of mining operations company once owned in Libby, Mont, where tests find dangerous levels of asbestos (S)

block.p: The Environmental Protection Agency has ordered W. R. Grace & Company to clean up the site of mining operations the company once owned in Libby, Mont., where tests found dangerous levels of asbestos.
Grace mined vermiculite for 27 years in the Libby area, and the operations sent tons of asbestos dust into the air. For years, local residents have blamed the asbestos for illnesses and deaths.
The Environmental Protection Agency has ordered W. R. Grace & Company to clean up the site of mining operations the company once owned in Libby, Mont., where tests found dangerous levels of asbestos.
Grace mined vermiculite for 27 years in the Libby area, and the operations sent tons of asbestos dust into the air. For years, local residents have blamed the asbestos for illnesses and deaths.
The E.P.A. began testing in the area last year after a series of newspaper articles focused new attention on the unusual mortality rate of former mine workers and members of their families.

Under an agreement with the agency, Grace will clean a site once used as a products transportation center in Libby. Agency officials also said the government would clean another Grace mining site just outside of Libby and seek reimbursement from the company afterward.
Officials said they expected the cleaning of both sites to be completed this summer.
